channel.title: Vanguard News » News
channel.description: A Nigerian newspaper and Online version of the Vanguard, a daily publication in Nigeria covering Niger delta, general national news, politics, business, energy, sports, entertainment, fashion,lifestyle human interest stories, etc

item.title: Naira gains N16, closes at N215/dollar
item.dc:creator: adekunle
item.description:
The naira appreciated, yesterday, against the US dollar in the parallel market, closing at N215 to a dollar. This represents an appreciation of N16 from Tuesday when a dollar exchanged for N231 in Lagos and Kano, and N230 to a dollar in Abuja.

The post Naira gains N16, closes at N215/dollar appeared first on Vanguard News.

item.title: Buhari brought N2.7trn investments from US visit – Presidency
item.dc:creator: adekunle
item.description:
An estimated N2.7 trillion ($13.6 billion) worth of direct investment is part of the immediate benefits accruing from President Muhammadu Buhari’s recent state visit to the United States, the Presidency claimed yesterday.

The post Buhari brought N2.7trn investments from US visit – Presidency appeared first on Vanguard News.

item.title: Ooni: Rites of passage for Oba Sijuade ongoing – Source
item.dc:creator: adekunle
item.description:
The remains of Ooni of Ife, Oba Okunade Sijuade, were Wednesday said to be in Ile’gbo, the place where his coronation took place.

The post Ooni: Rites of passage for Oba Sijuade ongoing – Source appeared first on Vanguard News.

item.title: Buhari’s anti-corruption stance, a witch-hunt – Fayose
item.dc:creator: adekunle
item.description:
Governor Ayodele Fayose of Ekiti State has taken a swipe at the Federal Government's anti-corruption stance, describing it as mere noise-making, witch-hunt and diversionary tactic to hoodwink the public into overlooking the seeming failure of the government to deliver on its electoral promises.

The post Buhari’s anti-corruption stance, a witch-hunt – Fayose appeared first on Vanguard News.

item.title: 2 beheaded, 4 injured in renewed Anambra/Kogi oil wells crisis
item.dc:creator: Femi Ajasa
item.description:
Awka—TWO persons were beheaded at Eziagulu Otu, near the embattled Orient Petroleum Resources Ltd in Anambra East Local Government Area yesterday by armed men suspected to be from Ibaji in Kogi State, who allegedly attacked the people in their farms.

The post 2 beheaded, 4 injured in renewed Anambra/Kogi oil wells crisis appeared first on Vanguard News.

item.title: Oil spillage: Buhari implements UNEP
item.dc:creator: Femi Ajasa
item.description:
ABUJA—President Muhammadu Buahri has given approval for the cleaning up of Ogoni land polluted with oil spillage.

The post Oil spillage: Buhari implements UNEP appeared first on Vanguard News.

item.title: Pension assets hit N4.746trn
item.dc:creator: adekunle
item.description:
MORE than 10 years after the inception of the Contributory Pension Scheme, CPS, following the Pension Reforms Act, PRA, of 2004, the pension assets have hit N4.746 trillion.

The post Pension assets hit N4.746trn appeared first on Vanguard News.

item.title: President decries level of debt in aviation sector
item.dc:creator: adekunle
item.description:
President Muhammadu Buhari, yesterday, in Abuja directed the Ministry of Aviation to contemplate plans of evolving a national carrier for Nigeria.

The post President decries level of debt in aviation sector appeared first on Vanguard News.

item.title: Siasia eyes All Africa Games gold
item.dc:creator: adekunle
item.description:
Ahead of the 2015 All Africa Games (AAG) taking place in Congo Brazzaville next month, Chief Coach of the national U-23 team, the Dream Team IV, Samson Siasia says his target at the championship is to win the gold medal of the soccer event.

The post Siasia eyes All Africa Games gold appeared first on Vanguard News.

item.title: To win battle against corruption, deliver infrastructure – Adegboruwa
item.dc:creator: Tony Chinonso
item.description:
Divide the Supreme Court according to the zones, at least 200 judges with 10 panels- sitting everyday to avoid conflict of decision. Those panels, one day the Chief Judge (CJ) would say “go to the South-East zone- sit in Port Harcourt and treat all appeals coming from Enugu, Calabar and other states. When you dispose of them, then return to Abuja.”

The post To win battle against corruption, deliver infrastructure – Adegboruwa appeared first on Vanguard News.
